Unabated Fight for Repeal of NSL in S. Korea
articles.content:
Unabated Fight for Repeal of NSL in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- The fight for the repeal of the "National Security Law" remains in high tide in south Korea.
 Yun Ki Jin, chairman of the South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification, in an appeal titled "Let us make a breakthrough in opening the year of independent reunification by getting the NSL totally scrapped" on December 15 noted that the reunification movement organizations as well as workers, peasants, youth and students, religionists, politicians and people of other strata of this land were turning out on to the streets with do-or-die resolution to have the NSL, an evil law against the nation, democracy and reunification, repealed within this year at any cost. The Grand National Party and other anti-reunification conservative forces, driven into a tight corner, are making desperate efforts to keep the evil law, trying by hook or by crook to fake up "pro-communism", the appeal said.
 It called for getting the NSL repealed within this year without fail and winning the first victory in ushering in the year of the withdrawal of the U.S. forces and the year of national reunification.    
 Meanwhile, the People's Solidarity for the Repeal of the "National Security Law" held a press conference in front of the "National Assembly" building in Seoul on Dec. 15 to appeal to the people to go all out in a grand candle-light march. And the People's Solidarity and the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) held a press conference in front of the Seoul District Prosecutor's Office on Dec. 14 demanding the acquittal of the chairman of Hanchongryon and the repeal of
the NSL within the year.    
 The hunger strike group of the People's Solidarity held a press conference in front of the "National Assembly" building on Dec. 13 at which it declared it would keep up the hunger strike till the evil law is repealed. It held a candle-light cultural function in front of the NA building that evening.

Greetings to Cambodian King
articles.content:
Greetings to Cambodian King 
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni on the 40th anniversary of the opening of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Cambodia.
 The message said the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries provided by President Kim Il Sung together with the Great King Norodom Sihanouk have steadily been developed over the last 40 years by the joint efforts of the two peoples.    
 In the past period the two peoples have tightly grasped hands and closely supported and cooperated with each other in the fight to repulse the aggressive moves of the hostile forces and defend the sovereignty of the nations, sharing weal and woe, it noted.
 Expressing the belief that the excellent relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries forged in the ordeals of history would continue to develop favorably in the future, the message wholeheartedly wished the king great success in accomplishing the noble cause.

articles.title: Greetings to Guinean Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Guinean Prime Minister 
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a message of greetings to Cellou Dalain Diallo upon his appointment as prime minister of Guinea.
 Expressing the belief that the excellent relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would steadily develop in the future, too, the message sincerely wished the prime minister great success at his new post.

Kim Yong Nam Sends Greetings to Chinese President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Greetings to Chinese President 
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Chinese President Hu Jintao on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the return of Macao to China.
 The message said that the return of Macao to China was a shining victory achieved by the Chinese party and government through a long-drawn struggle to restore the independence of the country and territorial integrity, adding that its return to China convinced once again the Chinese people of the justice of their cause and opened a more favorable prospect for reunifying the whole country.    
 It sincerely wished the Chinese party, government and people greater success in accomplishing the just cause of reunifying the whole country by "one country and two systems" formula under the leadership of the Communist Party of China headed by Hu Jintao.

articles.title: Greetings to Chinese Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Chinese Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to his Chinese counterpart Li Zhaoxing on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of Macao's return to China.
 The message noted that the return of Macao to China marked another historic occasion in China's eradication of the leftover of the distress-ridden past and a great achievement in demonstrating the dignity of the Chinese nation and boosting its foreign relations for territorial integrity.    
 It wished Li greater success in his responsible work to accelerate the reunification of the whole country and raise international prestige of China.

articles.title: Mongolian President Arrives
articles.content:
Mongolian President Arrives
    Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Mongolian President Natsagyn Bagabandi arrived here Tuesday by a special plane on an official visit to the DPRK at the invitation of Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.
 He and his entourage were greeted by Kim Yong Nam at the airport.
